page.title: 16FARMS AROUND CULWORTH 1
page.content: {WESTHILL FARM} One of the oldest farmhouses in the area.A listed,Grade 11 building,C17. Inside there is a noteworthy chequered "Culworth Marble" floor,black and white It is said to have once had an underground passage way to the Manor. The farm has today over 1000 sheep and 170 cattle,a few for milk most for slaughter. {FULFORD FARM} One of the newest farmhouses in the area.Owned by a Dutch industrialist, managed in his absence.The largest farm in the area,mostly arable-wheat barley and rape.There are 100 intensively reared bulls kept inside.There is a lot of new machinery around the farm including a brand new combine costing $6,000.
